title: Technical Program Manager, Money Movement and Storage
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
At Stripe, product development is an extremely collaborative effort between engineering, design, analytics, partnerships, legal, risk and go-to-market teams. You’d be joining a group of experienced Product Management, Strategy, and Operations leaders who have a track record of successfully building large-scale business and products that are collectively impacting millions of users around the world.
The Money Movement and Storage organization builds products and core systems that are responsible for Stripe’s money movement globally. We are looking for a senior Technical Program Manager who’s passionate about solving problems in the complex payments landscape, not only serving our customers but also our financial partner and regulator stakeholders.
What you’ll do
As a TPM, you will play a key role leading complex programs across multiple engineering, product and cross-functional (finance, legal, compliance, risk, and other) teams spanning Stripe. You will be an active contributor to the overall strategy of the program, drive technical decision making, and drive the execution of the program through all phases from planning to delivery. You will have the opportunity to implement mechanisms that make your programs effective and scale them to edit Stripe-level processes
Responsibilities

Drive functional and technical delivery of key team and org-wide programs/initiatives
Collaborate with engineering teams to design, scope, and shepherd features
Create functional specs, project / release plans, and roadmaps
Own and execute one or more software engineering programs simultaneously
Help drive product decisions to align with program and sometimes higher company initiatives
Help influence peers / managers and build consensus while dealing with ambiguity
Guide and manage the usage of agile methodologies to simplify project delivery

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

7+ years of experience in technical program/product management, software engineering, systems engineering or related discipline.
Consistent track record of shipping products with broad/global customer impact.
You have a track record of providing solid program management during all phases of software development from kick-off to ship, demonstrating critical thinking and thought leadership throughout.
You are not satisfied with just delivering programs on time—you are discerning about product/infrastructure architecture and can lead technical discussions.
Operate independently and lead efforts across multiple teams and functions, with stakeholders in different disciplines across time zones.
Ability to understand how functionality comes together (across products and platforms) to deliver value for users, and identify/mitigate delivery risks proactively.
Strong customer focus.
You have strong written and verbal communication skills. 
Interpersonal skills to build relationships, and collaborate with diverse cross-functional teams.
Demonstrable experience with agile software development methodologies and productivity tools.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering or a related field.

Preferred qualifications

Experience in a global FinTech or payments organization of a global e-commerce company.

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
